message_1: A car dealership sold a total of 125 cars last month. Out of those, 45 were SUVs, and 60 were sedans. How many of the remaining cars were trucks?
message_2:
To find out how many trucks were sold, we need to subtract the number of SUVs and sedans from the total number of cars sold.

Total cars sold = 125
SUVs sold = 45
Sedans sold = 60

Trucks sold = Total cars sold - (SUVs sold + Sedans sold)
Trucks sold = 125 - (45 + 60)
Trucks sold = 125 - 105
Trucks sold = 20

So, 20 trucks were sold last month.
